overview:
A computer scientists with over 8 years of industry experience working for companies such as Lockheed Martin, JPMorgan Chase & Co., Trustwave and Leapforce Software in San Francisco.

I am also the Founder/CEO, Publisher and Lead Developer at Noire Digerati, a company geared towards getting my generation of digital natives into tech, gaming, animation, mobile development careers through the development of k-12 curriculum and after school programs that teach these skills.

I am also the developer of Hacktionary, a web app for IT security professionals to stay abreast of security threats and trends. Working on the iPad app for Hacktionary to be released 4th quarter of this year, which will hopefully include real-time threat maps of hacks, fraud, and trends taken place around the world in real-time.

Currently finishing the development of an iPhone app called “Kupata” which means “Access” in Swahili. Kupata will be a news/multimedia app regarding all things digital divide and broadband happening in the Beltway and around the world. One of the cool features of the app will be the ability for users to see and vote (up or down) broadband ideas submitted to the FCC as well as submit their own broadband ideas.
